==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|き|かん|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Possibly coined in Japan as a compound of {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=きかん}}-derived elements {{compound|lang=ja|sort=きかん|旗|tr1=ki|t1=flag|艦|tr2=kan|t2=warship, navy ship}}, from the way that a fleet commander's signal flags would be flown from the mast of the flagship.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Alternately, possibly from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=きかん}} compound {{m|ltc|旗艦|tr=*ghiə *ɣam}}. Compare modern {{etyl|zh|-}} traditional {{m|zh|旗艦}} and simplified {{m|zh|旗舰|tr=qíjiàn}}.
